duties_responsibilities.duty: Act as the on-site project leader to plan, execute, and complete projects with assigned customers in a safe and cost-effective manner.

Perform or delegate tasks required to execute and fully complete assigned projects including hardware design, system programming, installation coordination, system and network commissioning, and project closeout.
Responsible for overall financial results of assigned projects including costs, project billings, and collections.
Maintain customer satisfaction and profitable and accurate project financial results.
Provide work direction to subcontractors, electrical installers, technicians, designers, and administration as necessary.
Ensure work performed is in compliance with legal requirements and operates with the highest ethics.
Complete typical installation hardware design and software programming using established standards.
Communicate both technical and business-related issues with clients.
Manage the selection, ordering, budget, and delivery schedule of materials to be procured for the projects assigned.
Oversee subcontractor payment and billing processes.
Provide jobsite coordination for panel and field device physical locations.
Ensure installation is in accordance with project requirements and standards.
Complete project billings in a timely and accurate format to the client. Maintain profitability goals and positive cash flow.
Provide coaching, mentoring, and technical assistance to System Technicians, Electrical Installers, and System Designers.
Develop project plans and coordinates required resources to ensure timely and cost-effective installation and completion of assigned projects.
Perform site-specific training for owner/operator on the total system.
Develop and maintain viable long-term relationships with contractors, clients, consultants, and subcontractors.
Attend job progress meetings as required.
Follow all safety standards and have the highest regard for employee and subcontractor safety.

education_certification.credential: Minimum of a technical Associates Degree with four years of field experience or six years of equivalent related field experience in the industry.
